entry.title: Como criar blogs incr√≠veis a partir das palestras dos eventos SAP?
entry.content:
@moshenaveh compartilhou uma metodologia pr√°tica para transformar apresenta√ß√µes de eventos em blogs r√°pidos e envolventes. Eis os passos-chave:

1Ô∏è‚É£Use o tutorial do SAP Community para habilitar o blogging.
2Ô∏è‚É£Crie um template dedicado ao evento (pr√© e p√≥s-evento).
3Ô∏è‚É£Transforme sua apresenta√ß√£o em texto com apoio de IA.
4Ô∏è‚É£Revise gram√°tica/estilo com ferramentas de IA.
5Ô∏è‚É£Enrique√ßa com imagens, slides e m√≠dia.
6Ô∏è‚É£Seja transparente ‚Üí use a tag GenAIAssistedContent.
7Ô∏è‚É£Publique na se√ß√£o correta da comunidade.
8Ô∏è‚É£Promova nas redes sociais e interaja nos coment√°rios.

Essa abordagem reduz o tempo de cria√ß√£o de horas para minutos, motiva mais palestrantes a compartilhar conhecimento  e amplia o impacto das sess√µes.

Que tal aplicar essas dicas no pr√≥ximo evento que voc√™ participar?

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 11th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/11/sap-developer-news-september-11th-2025/ 

CAP August 2025 release 

  • Release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/aug25  

ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-ai-chapter-2/ba-p/14210568 

SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-business-data-cloud-series-part-3-customer-managed-data-products/ba-p/14195545 
  • SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud ‚Äì a Typical Machine Learning Workflow: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-databricks-in-sap-business-data-cloud-a-typical-machine-learning/ba-p/14206612 
  • Data and AI at Devtoberfest: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events/label-name/data%20analytics%20ai  

Devtoberfest 2025 

  • Devtoberfest 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817 

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

  • Ceci‚Äôs blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/put-your-thinking-cap-on-it-s-time-to-make-some-tough-choices/ba-p/14211727 
  • SAP TechEd Session Catalog and Agenda Builder: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog 
  • SAP TechEd Berlin: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html 
  • SAP TechEd Virtual: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/virtual.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 CAP Aug 2025 release 

6:04 ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

7:25 SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

8:40 Devtoberfest 2025 

9:55 SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 11th, 2025.

[DJ] In case you missed it, the August 2025 release of CAP has landed with myriad updates. Now, this is going to be a slightly longer news item than usual, so grab a cup of tea and settle in. So, front and center for us all is the brand new cap‚âΩire organization on GitHub, which contains a reorganized set of repos, including individual sample repos, plus the cap‚âΩire documentation source repo itself, where contributions are welcome. Along with this reorganization comes continuous content deployments and a setup of package publication, which is great, not least for package reuse. And this cap‚âΩire organization is also the new home for discussions all around Cap. Check it out. So now in the new and recently GA, generally available topic, we can see that the previously beta-only support for persistent Fiori draft messages has now graduated and become GA. Also, there's a new MCP server for Cap that can provide AI-powered development help. Talking of GA in the language and compiler topic you may remember the introduction of support for expressions as first class annotation values well that support is also now GA. Staying in the language and compiler topic the query compiler has a new optimization for path expressions involving managed to one associations. A foreign key path expression is now translated to the local foreign key column instead of the joined remote one in the Node.js runtime this is now default and you can turn it on with a switch in the Java runtime. Now in a related update you can now collapse foreign key path expressions for managed to one associations into something simpler and let auto-coercion resolve this view into the more specific single foreign key specification like this example shown in a where clause. Now moving to the Node.js and Java runtimes there are plenty of updates too. Let's start with Node.js. There's a feature that was first introduced in the Java runtime back in April this year. This has also now been made available in Node.js. It's how elements that are annotated with common.txt are automatically included when a dollar search request is processed. Great stuff. There's also now a new database service level feature that allows you to stream query results direct from the persistence layer to the HTTP response, bypassing any need to materialize the result set in memory. There are also new features relating to requiring and connecting to remote services, a new utility method for working with linked definitions, and a new container for authentication-related information. And that's cdsuser.authinfo. This replaces the now deprecated cdsuser.tokeninfo. Moving to the Java runtime, there are quality of life, quality of dev life improvements when working with query results. For typed queries the results are automatically typed and you don't need to provide the access interface anymore if you're using the single list of or stream of methods. Now for single tenant applications, this is staying in a Java runtime right now, the feature attachment plugin now supports in an alpha version the SAP BTP object store and now you'll need a service binding to an object store backend. AWS's S3, Azure's blob storage, and Google's cloud storage are all supported. Now you may already know of CDS generate, part of the CDS Maven plugin, which automatically generates access interfaces for all structured CDS model types. This feature has been evolving and the team recommends you do use this as it brings benefits and in turn allows better compile time checking. Now, there's lots of detailed documentation on this, just waiting for your reading pleasure in cap‚âΩire, so go and check it out. Last but not least, there's now a convenience URL that you can directly select from the console log output, and it'll take you directly to the server's index page. Nice. Moving on to the tools area, the CDS plugin for IntelliJ is now at 2.0.0, and is now fully compatible with the free community edition of IntelliJ, which means that anyone and everyone can use IntelliJ for CAP development. The new 2.0.0 version brings lots of IDE features, lots of new features for the IDE, enhanced LSP integration and new options in the settings page. And there are also in the tools topic, new ESLint checks for JavaScript, making your life as a developer easier and the life of your code smoother. There are five safety checks so far, take a look in the cds lint section of cap hire. And last but certainly not least in this release there's been some awesome work in the area of GitHub actions, a new guide, sample workflows and lots more to help you manage test, deploy, package and release your CAP projects. Now that is cool. All this and more in the August 2025 release section of the CapHire documentation. Thanks, CapTeam.

 [Mamikee] Big news for ABAP developers. ABAP AI just keeps growing. Back in February, we announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Since then, there has been a wave of new AI-driven skills. Now, you can generate wrap business objects from the database table all the way to the UI service. You can create unit tests, explain code, complete code directly in the editor, and even implement validation and determination. These capabilities are already live in the SAP VTP ABAP environment and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. And they're coming to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in the 2025 release. Even better, ABAP AI remains free of charge. The free promotions we introduced earlier this year have been extended until further notice. And here is another big step forward. ABAP AI will also become available for older S/4HANA private releases. Think of an AI service running side-by-side with their ABAP instance. That means you can benefit from the latest innovations without waiting for an upgrade. Want the full details? You can stay tuned for TechEd 2025. And if you want to read more on these release updates, the link is in the description below.

[Witalij] SAP Business Data Cloud, BDC, brings a data product-centric approach to managing business data. Each data product is a curated, semantically enriched package of business process data, harmonized and replicated from systems like SAP S/4HANA. For solution developers and architects among here, BDC offers a standardized platform to build, extend, and consume these data products, exposing them through APIs or events for integration with both SAP and third-party applications. To dive deeper, check out the SAP Business Data Cloud blog series, including the latest post on customer-managed data products. You'll see how to build a custom data product in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using a custom CDS entity. There is also a dedicated series that walks through consuming data products in SAP Databricks for machine learning workflows and exposing them for inference. You'll find links to all these resources in the description. And as the Devtoberfest approaches, be sure to catch the sessions featuring product managers and the CTO of SAP Business Data Cloud.

[Daniel] SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin has just released the Agenda Builder, so you can now set your schedule for the event. Just scroll through all of the sessions, 250 keynotes, hands-on workshops, community talks, strategy talks, roadmaps and more. Select the ones that you like, click add to schedule and you're set to go. They are added to your dashboard. What's really great is that the sessions you would dream of missing are already in your schedule, like Key101, the Developer Keynote, run by a bunch of developer advocates you may recognize. If you're in Berlin, please drop by and say hello. If you can't make it to Berlin, you can still create an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual, and the same Key101 Developer Keynote will be automatically added to your schedule. I love playing with the theme.

[Michelle]  Howdy y'all, everyone's favorite fall tech fest is just about to start. Devtoberfest 2025 kicks off on September 29th, which is only a few weeks away. Each day spotlights a different theme: ABAP, frontend tooling, AI, and more. As in years past, it's free and fully online, so jump in, earn points on the scoreboard, chase nirvana and put yourself in the running for the grand prize, which this year is a retreat to a future TechEd event and meet us developer advocates in person. Check out the post linked below for more info on the great sessions we've got coming up and the contest to see how you can win that fantastic grand prize. We hope you're just as excited to participate as we are to go live, and as always, happy coding!

entry.title: Focused Run Configuration - SAP HANA Segregation of Duties for Privileges Issue
entry.content:
Hi,

I‚Äôm currently working on a SAP Focused Run policy that should report non-compliant users that have both USER ADMIN and ROLE ADMIN privileges in the SAP HANA Database. 

Please let me if any of you have had similar requirements.  Also Please let me know if you see anything wrong with the policy.

 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<targetsystem xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" desc="SOD TESTING NEW" id="ZTEST3" multisql="Yes" version="0000" xsi:schemaLocation="csa_policy.xsd">
<configstore name="HANA_SPECIAL_PRIVILIGES" sci_id="Z00002">
<checkitem desc="Check Privileges: Both USER ADMIN, ROLE ADMIN granted" id="ZPG_SECGRC_HAM14_01" not_found="positive">
<compliant>GRANTOR like '%' and PRIVILEGE in ('USER ADMIN', 'ROLE ADMIN') and GRANTEE_TYPE = 'USER' and IS_VALID like '%' and GRANTEE in ('SYSTEM','SAPHDB','SAPHANADB') and not (GRANTEE like '_SYS%') </compliant>
<noncompliant>GRANTOR like '%' and PRIVILEGE in ('USER ADMIN', 'ROLE ADMIN') and GRANTEE_TYPE = 'USER' and IS_VALID like '%' and not (GRANTEE in ('SYSTEM','SAPHDB','SAPHANADB')) and not (GRANTEE like '_SYS%')</noncompliant>
<joinstore name="HANA_SPECIAL_PRIVILIGES" no_data_found="Yes">
<joincompliant>GRANTOR like '%' and PRIVILEGE in ('USER ADMIN', 'ROLE ADMIN') and GRANTEE_TYPE = 'USER' and not (GRANTEE like '_SYS%') </joincompliant>
<joinnoncompliant>GRANTOR like '%' and PRIVILEGE in ('USER ADMIN', 'ROLE ADMIN') and GRANTEE_TYPE = 'USER' and not (GRANTEE like '_SYS%') </joinnoncompliant>
</joinstore>
</checkitem>
</configstore>
</targetsystem>

entry.title: Approval Model Query Problem
entry.content:
Hi everyone,üò±

I'm encountering an issue with the approval process in SAP Business One. I've configured a query to trigger approval only when at least one item in a sales quotation has a gross profit percentage below 27%.

The query checks each line individually, not the overall gross profit of the document. The idea is:

  • If any item has a gross profit percentage below 27%, the approval should be triggered.
  • If all items have a gross profit percentage above 27%, the approval should not be triggered ‚Äî even if the total gross profit is affected by other items.

However, the main problem is that the approval still gets triggered even when all items have a gross profit percentage higher than 27%. I've also tested using other fields like StickPrice and LineTotal, but the issue persists.

It seems like the system is evaluating the total gross profit or applying the condition incorrectly. Has anyone faced this behavior or found a reliable way to ensure the approval only activates when at least one item falls below the threshold?

My actual query is this but i tried differents query fields but nothing.

SELECT DISTINCT 'TRUE' FROM OQUT T0  INNER JOIN QUT1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"      
WHERE T1."DocEntry" = T0."DocEntry"
AND T1."LineTotal"  > 0
AND T1."StickPrice" > 0
AND T1."Quantity" > 0 
AND ((T1."LineTotal" - (T1."Quantity" * T1."StickPrice"))   / NULLIF (T1."LineTotal", 0)) * 100 < 27

Version Sap 9.3 

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: Support and Technical Users
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

I hope you are well. 

The Support and Technical Users view allows you to display all support and technical users available in your system for compliance purposes. You cannot make any changes to the support and technical users in the system.

A support user can be a business partner who needs access to the system for development and maintenance reasons, whereas a technical user can be a process or service that is used to automate a technical task in the system, for example, a print user that is required to set up central printing using the Print Manager.

You can get more information over the following link below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESS_BYDESIGN/2754875d2d2a403f95e58a41a9c7d6de/2dd49019722d101495caee46c29f0b7c.html?locale=en-US

Please also take a look on KBA below which has many FAQ related to this topic.

2608632 - Frequently Asked Questions on Identity and Access Management
https://me.sap.com/notes/2608632

Hope it can clarify your questions.

Regards,
Tiago
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: Production Order Cost Details for COGS Report
entry.content:
Hi @Jaavani_1016 ,

  1. Data Sources for Production Order Costs

For production order actual and planned costs, the following standard CDS views (and their underlying tables) are relevant:

Requirement

Standard CDS View

Backend Table(s)

Notes

Planned & actual cost by manufacturing order (ledger-specific)

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost

ACDOCA (universal journal), AUFK, AFPO

Needs ledger, version, and period selection.

Product cost collector actual/target cost

I_PCCActlTgtCostCube

ACDOCA, COSS/COSP, AUFK

Relevant if you‚Äôre using product cost collectors (repetitive manufacturing).

Order header details (customer, FG code, qty, R/C No)

I_ProductionOrder / I_MfgOrderItem

AUFK, AFPO

Links the controlling objects to material and customer.

Material master (FG code ‚Üí part name)

I_MaterialText

MAKT

To get finished good description.

  1. Why You‚Äôre Not Seeing Data
  • Both I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost and I_PCCActlTgtCostCube pull data from ACDOCA, but only if:
    • The order is settled or has postings (actual cost won‚Äôt exist if no confirmation, GI, or settlement done).
    • You use the right ledger (0L) and version (000 for actual, 001 for plan/target).
    • You provide fiscal year, period, and controlling area as parameters.

If you run without these, the CDS view often returns blank.

  1. Parameters Needed

For both CDS views, typically required filters are:

  • ControllingArea (KOKRS)
  • FiscalYear (GJAHR)
  • FiscalPeriod (POPER)
  • Ledger (e.g., 0L)
  • Version (000 = actuals, 001 = plan/target costs)
  • ManufacturingOrder (AUFNR)
  1. Report Layout Mapping

Report Field

Source

Customer

From sales order ‚Üí I_SalesOrderItemCube joined with production order (settlement rule / account assignment)

SAP Finished goods code

I_ProductionOrder ‚Üí Material

Part name

I_MaterialText (MAKT)

Qty

I_ProductionOrder (AFPO-GAMNG / delivered qty)

R/C No (Order No)

AUFNR from I_ProductionOrder

Planned cost

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost (Ledger=0L, Version=001)

Actual cost

I_MfgOrderActlPlanTgtLdgrCost (Ledger=0L, Version=000)

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Hi Folks - Anyone using automation to setup bulk volu...
entry.content:
Hi @AnshulJ ,

Try below options:-

  1. Options for Bulk Company Code Setup
  2. a) SAP MDG ‚Äì Central Governance
  • In MDG-F (Financials), company codes, charts of accounts, and financial org units can be created and governed as master data objects.
  • You can leverage:
    • File upload (Excel/CSV) via Data Import Framework (DIF).
    • SAP MDG Data Replication Framework (DRF) to replicate new company codes into S/4HANA (both GL & FPSL).
  • Good for controlled governance + approval workflows.
  1. b) Central Business Configuration (CBC)
  • CBC supports initial configuration during S/4HANA Cloud onboarding, but for mass company codes it‚Äôs still quite manual.
  • You can use ‚ÄúCopy Company Code‚Äù functionality in CBC but automating this for hundreds of entities is limited.
  • SAP recommends using Central Finance/MDG instead of CBC for large-scale automation.
  1. c) SAP S/4HANA APIs / BAPIs
  • For on-prem or private cloud, you can use:
    • BAPI_COMPANYCODE_CREATE1 ‚Äì to create company codes.
    • BAPI_FLCU_CREATE / BAPI_FLCU_CHANGE ‚Äì for customer-related financial data.
    • Custom ABAP programs / LSMW / LTMC / Migration Cockpit for initial loads.
  • Can be wrapped into Robotic Process Automation (SAP Build Process Automation / IRPA) to scale.
  1. d) FPSL Specific
  • FPSL (Financial Products Subledger) works with ledger groups and valuation areas.
  • You need to replicate company codes from MDG/S4 into FPSL‚Äôs Org Unit customizing tables.
  • Typically automated via:
    • ALE/IDoc replication (via DRF).
    • Custom mass upload programs delivered by SAP FPSL accelerator packs.
  1. Automation Tools in Practice
  • SAP Build Process Automation (BPA / IRPA) ‚Üí Can record CBC or SPRO config steps and loop them for bulk company code creation.
  • SAP Solution Manager / ChaRM Transport Automation ‚Üí Automates movement of customizing across systems.
  • SAP Landscape Transformation (SLT) ‚Üí Not directly for company codes, but useful for replication scenarios.
  1. Best Practice Setup Flow
  1. Maintain company code master data in MDG-F (single source of truth).
  2. Use DRF replication to push into S/4HANA GL and FPSL customizing tables.
  3. For mass loads: use Migration Cockpit or custom ABAP BAPI loaders if MDG isn‚Äôt in scope.
  4. For automation at scale ‚Üí wrap with BPA bots or API scripts.

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Agentic AI ‚Äì AI which finally makes sense?
entry.content:
‚ÄúA computer can never be held accountable, therefore a computer must never make a management decision.‚Äù ‚Äì IBM Training Manual, 1979[1][2]

So, where are we with AI now? Isn‚Äôt Agentic AI doing exactly what it isn‚Äôt supposed to do?

AI or ML or?

We are bombed with terms ‚Äì small break! Let‚Äôs digest this grocery of terms‚Ä¶

  • Data Science[3] is a broad interdisciplinary scientific field using scientific methods to extract knowledge and insights from the massive data sets. It uses both; traditional data mining, data analysis and statistical methods; as well as ML techniques, to accomplish the given tasks.
  • AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the broadest concept, aiming to create machines that can "think" and perform human-like tasks.
  • ML (Machine Learning)[3] is a subset of AI where algorithms learn from data without explicit programming, enabling predictions and pattern recognition. It does need Data Science to be employed first to clean, prepare and analyze unstructured big data
  • Deep Learning[4] is a type of ML based on artificial neural networks impersonating human ‚Äúthinking‚Äù.

Neither ML nor AI are something brand new. It is considered that earliest ML ‚Äúprogram‚Äù was introduced in the early 1950s (by Arthur Samuel). Mid 1950s was the time when AI somehow emerged as well. However, only in 2000s ML/AI started being more popular ‚Äì simply because machines could not cope with the complex ML/AI processing, before that time. The real break-through (sort-of) came only in 2012 with Deep-Learning. Everything else is now a ‚Äúlegend‚Äù‚Ä¶

Figure 1. Data Science as a discipline

Is this the correct relationship between ML and AI?

There are somewhat different views, but let‚Äôs stick with the one which is the most common; Deep Learning is a subset of ML, ML is subset of AI, and Data Science is here to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù them all. Still let me just mention ‚Äì some other interpretation would put ‚Äúall‚Äù under umbrella of Dats Science, while some views say that AI is only ‚Äúpartially overlapping‚Äù with ML and Deep Learning. However, we will (at least in this article) stay with the relationships as presented in this diagram.

Generative AI

AI is great, but next big evolution happened with Generative AI (or GenAI)[5].

So, what is Generative AI? While AI is very broad field of computer science focused on enabling machines to perform human-like tasks, Generative AI is a specialized subset of AI (or Traditional AI, as often referred) that creates new, original content such as text, images, or music ‚Äì impersonating human-like creativity.

When we talk about GenAI, sometimes we mixed it with LLM (Large Language Model) ‚Äì but this is, of course, not correct. GenAI encompasses various forms of content generation, while LLM is a foundation model for NLP (Natural Language Processing) tasks ‚Äì oriented to text understanding and generation only.

Both GenAI, in general, and LLM are in the essence based on Deep Learning models.

Figure 2. Generative AI

Whether we talk about text, or image or music creation, the flow is basically the same; there is a prompt (usually created by the user), invoking GenAI processing of the request to understand and generate appropriate content (i.e. text or answer on the specific inquiry), and finally there is a GenAI generated response returned to the requestor.

Agentic AI

And here we come to Agentic AI, next big hype ‚Äì AI which makes sense? AI which can make actual decisions!

In general, it is scary ‚Äì I admit. But at least, now we have a concept which can really, really be useful in the daily work. Do not take me wrong GenAI is also useful for quite a few things, but it was mostly limited to do some recommendations, suggestions etc.‚Äì it was more as an assistant helping us do the work, but we still had to make decisions and do the work by ourselves. But now with Agentic AI we actually have a tool which can make the decision and do the actual work. Yes, it is scary really ‚Äì but it is a reality, as well‚Ä¶

Agentic AI[6][7] is an AI system, with enhanced autonomy, enabling it to independently set goals, make decision on it, plan actions accordingly, and finally execute necessary tasks, without human intervention. Unlike Traditional AI, or ‚Äúonly‚Äù Generative AI, Agentic AI Systems are capable to understand complex context, learn from the interactions, and adapt to changing conditions. Within its ‚Äúcore‚Äù, Agentic AI Systems integrate LLMs ‚Äì to work together with other agents. Agents can be other ML models, but those could be also calls to external tools (i.e. like API calls, DB actions etc.). In the system, through AI Orchestration each agent is performing specific subset of tasks required to reach the overall goal.

Figure 3. Agentic AI System has ‚Äúbrain‚Äù, ‚Äúmemory‚Äù and ‚Äútools‚Äù

It is exactly because of ‚Äúagents‚Äù working with LLM ‚Äúbrain‚Äù, this approach is demonstrating high autonomy in solving problems; from understanding the context, invoking the right agents to perform ‚Äúmicro‚Äù tasks; aggregating all results, measure the success rate in meeting the goal, make the decision and execute the actions.

Agentic AI is focused on decisions as opposed to creating the content, like GenAI. Agentic AI does not rely on human prompts and does not require human supervision. But Agentic AI and GenAI tools work together, each of them takes their own role. In fact, Agentic AI could not do what it does, if there are no GenAI capabilities ‚Äì core of the Agentic AI System relies on GenAI to make actions on the initial prompts (or inputs invoking specific agents via AI Orchestration), evaluating responses received form the agents, and generating final human-like responses on the prompts (if such actions is needed).

Figure 4. An example of steps within Agentic AI System

In real terms, the process could look like this:

  1. Agentic AI System uses its brain (i.e. LLMs) to understand the context (i.e. understand that prompt is asking for the specific Sales Order status) and generate the content for the external tool agents (i.e. API call to the ERP system).
  2. Usually, Agentic AI System will also have memory to store past context ‚Äì to be smarter with similar prompts in future.
  3. AI Orchestration will invoke tools which will perform specific tasks (i.e. read the Sales Order detail from the ERP system, read LMD delivery status, retrieve knowledge from RAG or simply engage other agent) and return the results to the brain.
  4. All responses will be aggregated (i.e. if we are invoking several tools).
  5. Agentic AI brain may evaluate the conditions (if met) or it may measure success rate toward set goals (if satisfaction level reached).
  6. At the end, Agentic AI brain may trigger some actions, including providing response to the requester ‚Äìthis time it will create the content (i.e. human-like response with the Sales Order status).

Another typical example would be autonomous vehicles (or self-driving cars), where car AI must understand the complex context of the surrounding driving conditions, take the necessary inputs, and act toward reaching the goal. In this process car AI will make autonomous driving decisions and steer the vehicle accordingly.

This is why Agentic AI is Ai which actual does make sense ‚Äì as it actually can work for us‚Ä¶ Of course, will it (eventually) work only for us ‚Äì this is completely different topic ‚Äì which I will try to address in the separate article.

Some more practical examples, addressing some additional topics about A2A, MCP including some SAP specific topics like Content Based Agents vs. Code Based Agents ‚Äì I will also try to cover in the separate article.

And don‚Äôt worry. Agentic AI is current hype ‚Äì but AI is evolving, there will more and more ‚Äúhypes‚Äù in the future, I am quite certain‚Ä¶

Final Thoughts

So, Agentic AI makes decisions ‚Äì and not only that, but they also execute actions! Let‚Äôs think about future and ‚Äúreal‚Äù self-driving cars!

Then, are we actually violating the principles set by IBM in 1979? I am not going to answer this question, but answer seems to be quite straight-forward, right?

Welcome to the future‚Ä¶

Acknowledgment

*) Intro photo by Nahrizul Kadri on Unsplash

**) This article uses SAP Business Technology Platform Solution Diagrams & Icons as per SAP Terms of Use  governing the use of these SAP Materials (please note, newer version of the Solution Diagrams & Icons, as well as Terms of Use, might be in place after the publication of this article).

More guidelines on Solution Diagrams & Icons can be found in this article by Bertram Ganz.

References

[1] IBM: AI decision-making: Where do businesses draw the line? | IBM

[2] LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7271085510142439426/

[3] IBM: Data science vs. machine learning: What's the Difference? | IBM

[4] Wikipedia: Deep learning - Wikipedia

[5] Forbes: The Difference Between Generative AI And Traditional AI: An Easy Explanation For Anyone

[6] IBM: What Is Agentic AI? | IBM

[7] IBM: Agentic AI vs. Generative AI | IBM

entry.title: Re: delete a user in sap lms
entry.content: @user116, it's possible that this user isn't a Learning only user anymore. In the Learning Administration area > In the user record > "User Details" tab > A note should be displayed stating something like "Certain fields on the page are read-only because they contain HR data and should be maintained in your core HR system of record". This means this user exists in BizX as well. The deletion of users under this scenario needs to take place in BizX, via DRTM (KBA 2615360). For Learning only users (not existing in BizX), you may advance with the "Native User Deletion" automatic process (KBA 2515540).

Kind regards,

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Transport of analytical query variants
entry.content:
Hello customer,

Indeed, the recommendations to transport analytical queries bookmarks/variants is outlined in the KBA 0003361686: Bookmarks transportation guidance.

Transporting bookmarks is not possible in releases lower than SAP_BW 757. This new functionality is available only from SAP_BW 757 release.

Only public bookmarks can be transported. Transport of BW Bookmarks is possible via two ABAP reports:

  • FPM_BICS_TRANSPORT_BOOKMARKS: Collect the desired Bookmarks in a customizing request in the source system. The customizing request can be then released via transaction SE09.
  • FPM_BICS_IMPORT_BOOKMARKS: Import the transported Bookmarks into the BICS environment of the target system.

Refer to SAP Note 3336542 - BICS Data Grid: Transport of Bookmarks.

Best Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Target hours not appearing in Manage My Timesheet
entry.content:
Hello @SAPSupport 

Could you please load target hours by firstly ensuring daily availability is in place and then confirming the employee has the correct Data Entry Profile? Check availability using CDS I_TimeOverviewByWrkAgrmtAndDte;

if you are not using SuccessFactors EC, create or replicate availability via API_MANAGE_WF_AVAILABILITY. Next, verify Maintain Data Entry Profiles (Time Recording) so the timesheet displays recorded and target hours. If it still doesn‚Äôt appear, please review KBA 3391722 for common causes (work schedule validity, holiday calendar, employment dates).

SAP Help Portal-Time Overview of a Work Agreement (From Manage Workforce Availability API)

entry.title: SAP Customer Conversations: Executive Strategy with Delta Airlines
entry.content:
Join us in the upcoming SAP Customer Conversations LIVE Event hosted by Delta Air Lines. 

Hear Tim Gregory, Managing Director - HR Innovation and Workforce Technology @ Delta Air Lines, share his executive overview on Delta's Talent Transformation, as well as long-term goals and expected outcome investment.

Register now

About:

Delta Air Lines, Inc. is a major airline in the United States and ranks first in revenue & brand value among the world's largest airlines, and second by number of passengers carried, passenger miles flown, & fleet size. As a purpose-driven brand, Delta strives to connect its over 100,000 employees to opportunities both in the air and on the ground. By moving to a skills-based talent strategy, Delta is improving the lives of its people and realizing its vision for a virtuous circle of satisfied employees, customers, and shareholders.

Event Agenda:

  • Introductions
  • Executive level overview
  • Long term goals
  • Expected outcome of investment
  • Interactive Q&A session

Challenges and Highlights:
For years, Delta had been relying on learning and performance solutions from SAP to equip employees for success. However, the airline knew it had many employees with hidden skills, talents, and career aspirations that had yet to be discovered. To realize their goal, Delta wanted to create a digital virtuous circle by using technology to better align customer expectations with employee skills.
By moving to a skills-based talent strategy, Delta has surpassed its goal of filling 25% of
its managerial roles with internal hires from customer-facing positions‚Äîreaching nearly 50%. By unlocking employee potential and enhancing skills, Delta is creating a cycle of engaged employees, satisfied customers, and long-term shareholder investment.

SAP Solutions: (Reference Customer SAP solutions landscape) 

Delta is using SAP SuccessFactors Opportunity Marketplace to enhance workforce agility by connecting employees with career pathways and relevant recommendations for growth. Talent Intelligence Hub is used to refine career development and internal mobility using data-driven insights from a vast job attributes library. In addition, Delta is utilizing SuccessFactors Compensation, Learning, and SAP Build Work Zone to support its broader skills evolution journey, reinforcing its commitment to internal mobility, learning, and employee experience.

entry.title: Re: Display List report as Result From RAP Application Af...
entry.content:
@Abhishek4795 

The easiest way is to return "$self" from the action as shown in the example below:

action some_action result [1] $self;

In the behavior implementation, update the entity and get the updated entity, then return the result.

    "read changed data for action result
    READ ENTITIES OF zi_person_m IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY person
        ALL FIELDS WITH
        CORRESPONDING #( keys )
        RESULT DATA(persons).

    result = VALUE #( FOR person IN persons ( %tky = person-%tky
                                              %param = person ) ).

entry.title: [In-person] SAP ALM Deep Dive Workshop - Melbourne Edition
entry.content:
Hello All,

We‚Äôre excited to invite you to our in-person SAP Cloud ALM Deep Dive Workshops, taking place across SAP offices in Australia and New Zealand this October and November.

This full-day event is crafted to provide you with valuable insights and hands-on experience in managing operations and implementations with SAP Cloud ALM, helping you drive business transformation efficiency and innovation.

Why attend?

Explore the latest advancements and innovations in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation and operation through firsthand experience. You can also earn the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge by completing the assessment and take advantage of the opportunity to network with experts and peers exchanging insights, best practices and learnings.

Event Highlights:

  • Explore the importance of a robust ALM strategy for driving business growth and agility.
  • Gain in-depth knowledge about SAP Cloud ALM and its pivotal role in managing intelligent cloud and hybrid business landscapes.
  • Explore new topics including AI use cases, integration into the tool chain, and support for RISE with SAP & Clean Core.
  • Participate in a hands-on session to learn how the integrated toolchain of SAP Cloud ALM, SAP Signavio, and SAP LeanIX helps customers smoothly transition to an intelligent enterprise.
  • Understand the transition path from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM.
  • Enhance your expertise by taking the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test, which will demonstrate your ability to effectively manage the design to deploy phase of business transformations using an integrated approach with an end-to-end tool chain.

Please note: We encourage you to bring your own laptop for the workshop. A dedicated network will be provided during the hands-on sessions and the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test.

Visit our website for detailed information on the agenda, timings, and location. 

Registration is free, but subject to approval!

Register Now

entry.title: Re: To start GRDC package from the "Closing balance value"
entry.content:
Thank you for your great advice!

I have confirmed the functionality.
I was aware of the new feature in 2508, and thought that it would be possible to enter total amounts in columns with transaction type = blank, but since the feature "treats data with missing dimensions as total amount entry," I was able to achieve this by completely removing sub-items from the package form.

However, due to the specifications described above, it is not possible to display opening balance values ‚Äã‚Äãin input forms that require total amount entry.
I look forward to future updates to address this functional limitation.

This full-day event is crafted to provide you with valuable insights and hands-on experience in managing operations and implementations with SAP Cloud ALM, helping you drive business transformation efficiency and innovation.

Why attend?

Explore the latest advancements and innovations in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation and operation through firsthand experience. You can also earn the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge by completing the assessment and take advantage of the opportunity to network with experts and peers exchanging insights, best practices and learnings.

Event Highlights:

  • Explore the importance of a robust ALM strategy for driving business growth and agility.
  • Gain in-depth knowledge about SAP Cloud ALM and its pivotal role in managing intelligent cloud and hybrid business landscapes.
  • Explore new topics including AI use cases, integration into the tool chain, and support for RISE with SAP & Clean Core.
  • Participate in a hands-on session to learn how the integrated toolchain of SAP Cloud ALM, SAP Signavio, and SAP LeanIX helps customers smoothly transition to an intelligent enterprise.
  • Understand the transition path from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM.
  • Enhance your expertise by taking the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test, which will demonstrate your ability to effectively manage the design to deploy phase of business transformations using an integrated approach with an end-to-end tool chain.

Please note: We encourage you to bring your own laptop for the workshop. A dedicated network will be provided during the hands-on sessions and the Solution Transformation Consultant Badge test.

Visit our website for detailed information on the agenda, timings, and location. 

Registration is free, but subject to approval!

entry.title: Re: Transfer Direct Reports upon Termination
entry.content:
Hi @waitzechin15,

As far as I have understood your question, you want the assignment of the direct reports to the next available position in the position hierarchy, and you don't want to give any other option to the user. You can do so by putting (Position Management Settings -->)  Reassign Direct Reports According to Position Hierarchy on Termination Screen and Internal Hire Screen to "Yes-Always" as shown below.

Hope this helps!

Jayendra

entry.title: Finance Part2 & Reporting - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 6th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Finance (part 2) and Reporting

  • Recording
  • Presentatio
  • Accelerator Guide
    • Fix Asset Implementation Accelerator - Data Extraction via Customer Data Return App
    • Preparing Embedded Analytics

Key Discussion Points‚Äå

‚Äå1. Finance Part 2 - Fixed Asset Migration‚Äå

  • ‚ÄåCompany Code Synchronization:‚Äå Ensure newly created company codes are synchronized for asset accounting via the "Make Company Code Settings Asset-Specific" app.
  • ‚ÄåLow Value Asset Threshold:‚Äå Customizing for low-value assets currently cannot be modified; updates will be rolled out in the 2508.3 release by November.
  • ‚ÄåLegacy Data Transfer Settings:‚Äå Define migration key dates (e.g., December 31, 2025) and set data transfer status to "Ongoing" for transactional postings.
  • ‚ÄåMaster Data Migration:‚Äå Use the "Customer Data Return - Extraction" app (F5233) and the ‚ÄúCustomer Data Return ‚Äì Provisioning" app (F5234) to extract fixed asset data (XML/CSV format) for template uploads. Key recommendations:
    • Migrate main and sub-asset numbers in the same project.
    • Manually transfer assets under construction and link them post-migration.
    • Deactivated assets must be migrated as active and deactivated later.
  • ‚ÄåPosting Migration:‚Äå Extract accumulated APC/depreciation values via the "Depreciation List" app (F1616) in both cases, fiscal year equals calendar year (year-end-migration) and fiscal year differs from calendar year (during-the-year-migration). "Asset Transactions" app (F1614) can be used to extract posted data until your migration date (for during-the-year-migration).

‚Äå2. Analytics & Reporting Transition:‚Äå

  • ‚ÄåCustom CDS Views:‚Äå Check join conditions, calculations (e.g., hardcoded company codes), and currency field properties. Use parameters for dynamic filtering.
  • ‚ÄåCustom Analytical Queries:‚Äå Implement restricted measures (e.g., "Amount Before Migration") to separate pre/post-transition data. Add currency conversion measures for EUR transitions.
  • ‚ÄåTesting & Validation:‚Äå Prioritize external reporting, validate with business users, and update bookmarks/filters (e.g., company code, plant).

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‚Äå

‚ÄåQuestion‚Äå

‚ÄåAnswer

Low Value Asset Testing

Can we test low-value asset processes before the November hotfix?

No, EUR related low-value assets tests can be performed once release 2508.3 is rolled out in November 2025.

Fixed Asset Data Extraction

How is the extracted XML used for migration?

The XML consolidates asset data (e.g., master data, ledgers) for easier template population. Data must be manually copied into migration cockpit templates.

Analytics Filtering

How to handle legacy vs. migrated data in reports?

Avoid global filters; use restricted measures (e.g., "Amount Before Migration") and mandatory parameters (e.g., company code) for accurate comparisons.

 

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Q&A for all area)
  • please kindly bookmark this blog - How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers (with all accelerators, replay, upcoming session)

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

entry.title: Will people still able to access my iflow even after I expose via API Management's Proxy?
entry.content:
Hi,

API management's Proxy is able to discover CI iflow and act as a layer and adding a security that can be implemented via some API policies (access control, etc). Therefore, we are exposing the API proxy's URL instead of the iflow endpoint's URL.

However, if someone knows the iflow endpoint's URL, does that mean the person can bypass the API proxy and access the iflow directly?

 

Thank you.

entry.title: Settings that hides the catalogs and groups which are not assigned with any roles in btp launchpad
entry.content: We use btp neo environment and portal service to configure our launchpad. We have many applications which were only for testing purpose is assigned to catalogs and groups but not to any roles. So these applications were visible only in test environment for a developer. But recently there was a change deployed to site in production which was related to some other activity. After this change the end users in the production started seeing all the test applications. So wanted to know if there is any settings to hide these groups that might have toggled during the change or else what could be the reason for displaying the groups without roles?

What S/4HANA release is your system on? S/4HANA 2023 and SP18 in combination had significant effort to improve performance with RFUI flavors. On lower releases, performance is not as optimized.

Also, as a usual recommendation: Try deleting all flavor versions older than the most recent one permanently (not just mark as deleted) and compress the undo history / changes for the latest flavor version. You can do these in the Admin application.

entry.title: Re: Missing SR INTERNAL LB
entry.content:
Hi Jan,

The reason why you are unable to raise request "Create Hyperscaler LB for INBOUND traffic from an INTERNAL source (Azure/AWS/GCP) " is because you don't have the necessary authorization to do so.

In order to submit a service request for the 'Create Hyperscaler LB template for INBOUND traffic from an EXTERNAL source (Azure/AWS/GCP)' template, an S-user must have the authorization 'Create Billable Service Requests' at the customer number level.

Upon reviewing your S-user ID, I found that the required authorization was only assigned at the installation level. Usually, you will need to contact your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization assigned. For more detailed information on S-user authorizations required the Private Cloud Service Request application, please refer to KBA 2669783 - S-user authorizations required for the Private Cloud Service Request application - SAP for... 

If you have any questions or require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Lot sizing procedure in APP Monitor Material Coverage...
entry.content:
Hello @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question to the community.

You are right those functionalities are not available in the public cloud because the app has a predefined set of filters and display columns delivered by SAP.

Here are some available options to add it.

  • You can use Custom CDS Views app to extend the underlying data model for material coverage with the field Lot Sizing Procedure. Then Create a Custom Analytical Query and publish it as a Fiori app. This enables you to replicate the material coverage functionality and include the additional fields like Lot Sizing.
  • Secondly, you can use the custom field logic. If the lot sizing field is not exposed in your relevant business context, you cannot add it directly. In that case, you can use CFL to expose it if that business context is provided by SAP.
  • Finally, if your purpose is analysis rather than operational rescheduling, use apps like monitor Material Coverage or Manage Material Shortages and complement them with a custom analytical report ensuring you include Lot Size.

Consider submitting a request via the SAP Customer Influence Portal to have Lot Sizing procedure included as a standard field in the app.

App Extensibility: Manage Material Coverage (F0251A)

Lot-Sizing Procedures

I hope this provides the desired insight. Do not hesistate if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to prevent creating planned order when MRP run wi...
entry.content:
Hi @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, when an item's BOM is inactive, MRP may still create a planned order with empty components, since the system cannot find a BOM to explode. However, when converting to a production order, the system does block the creation due to missing components. There is currently no delivered configuration to make MRP block planned order creation for materials with inactive BOMs. Planned orders are created based on requirements, not BOM status.

Below are some workaround recommendations

  • Ensure that inactive BOMs are not just flagged inactive but they also should not have a validity date range. If the BOM is outside its validity period, MRP will not consider it and the requirement should trigger exception.
  • Consider using MRP 4 view as the selection method. If this is set to 2 which is the production version, then MRP requires a valid and released production version. If no valid production version exists, MRP will not create a planned order and will raise an excelption message.
  • The recommended SAP Best Practice is to use Production Versions as the default method for Bom or routing selection.
  • You can implement additional process controls, such as workflow notifications for materials with inactive BOMs, so planners can manually adjust requirements or BOM status before MRP run.

If this requirement is critical for your business process control, I suggest you consider raising a feature request on SAP‚Äôs Customer Influence Portal to provide an MRP enhancement for BOM activation status filtering.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris
